title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

Stating r = 2m, with some attempt at justification.

Indicating that the initial and final electric potential are the same at this point, with some connection to conservation of energy.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

Identifies a correct feature, such as E(r = 5) = 0 or that E is positive for r < 5m and negative for r > 5m.

Provides a correct justification, such as the fact that E is the negative slope of V with respect to position, so E = 0 when the slope of V = 0, or that the direction of E is toward lower electric potential.

Student response accurately includes one of the following criteria.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
Student response does not accurately include the following criteria.

Identifies an incorrect feature, such as E(r) is linear and cannot be the derivative of a graph whose concavity changes, or that E(r) should also be zero at r = 0 and/or at r = 10m.

Provides correct justification, such as the fact that E(r) is the negative derivative of V(r)

title: Part (e)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:

The student correctly identifies that Gauss’s law should be used derive p(r) from E(r)
